title: General Knowledge Quiz XVI (50 Questions)
description: Challenging but fair across logic, cultural traditions, biology, mathematics, and inventions. No sports content.

items.q: What fallacy attacks a person’s character instead of addressing the argument?
items.a: Ad hominem - diverts from the actual issue

items.q: Which fallacy assumes what it’s trying to prove (circular reasoning)?
items.a: Begging the question - petitio principii

items.q: What is the valid argument form: If P→Q, P; therefore Q?
items.a: Modus ponens - rule of inference in propositional logic

items.q: What is the fallacy of falsely reducing options to two?
items.a: False dilemma - overlooks alternatives

items.q: What is the valid argument form: If P→Q, ¬Q; therefore ¬P?
items.a: Modus tollens - contrapositive inference

items.q: Which fallacy infers causation from mere correlation?
items.a: Post hoc (false cause) - cum hoc ergo propter hoc

items.q: What is a contradiction in formal logic?
items.a: A statement that is always false - cannot be true under any valuation

items.q: What is Occam’s razor?
items.a: Heuristic favoring simpler explanations when all else is equal

items.q: What does ‘non sequitur’ mean in logical discourse?
items.a: “It does not follow.” - conclusion does not logically follow from premises

items.q: Which fallacy misrepresents an opponent’s argument to make it easier to attack?
items.a: Straw man - distorts or oversimplifies the claim

items.q: Which Japanese spring tradition involves viewing cherry blossoms?
items.a: Hanami - festive appreciation of sakura in bloom

items.q: Which Mexican holiday honors deceased loved ones with altars and marigolds?
items.a: Día de los Muertos (Day of the Dead) - celebrated Nov 1–2

items.q: Which Indian harvest festival is celebrated in Punjab with bhangra dancing?
items.a: Baisakhi (Vaisakhi) - marks Sikh New Year and harvest

items.q: Which Muslim festival ends the month of Ramadan?
items.a: Eid al‑Fitr - ‘Festival of Breaking the Fast’

items.q: Which Chinese festival is marked by lanterns on the 15th day of the first lunar month?
items.a: Lantern Festival - closes Lunar New Year celebrations

items.q: Which Brazilian festival features samba parades and elaborate costumes before Lent?
items.a: Carnaval - Rio’s world‑famous pre‑Lenten celebration

items.q: Which Jewish festival commemorates the rededication of the Second Temple?
items.a: Hanukkah - Festival of Lights lasting eight nights

items.q: Which Thai festival releases candlelit baskets onto waterways?
items.a: Loy Krathong - also features sky lanterns in some regions

items.q: Which Celtic festival is considered a precursor to Halloween?
items.a: Samhain - marks the end of harvest and beginning of winter

items.q: Which Hindu festival celebrates the birth of Krishna?
items.a: Janmashtami - observed with fasting, singing, and temple rituals

items.q: What is the largest living bird by height?
items.a: Ostrich - flightless bird native to Africa

items.q: Which mammal lays eggs instead of giving birth to live young?
items.a: Platypus - monotreme along with echidnas

items.q: What is the process by which caterpillars become butterflies?
items.a: Metamorphosis - transformation via pupal stage

items.q: Which plant family includes peas, beans, and lentils that fix nitrogen?
items.a: Legumes (Fabaceae) - symbiosis with Rhizobium bacteria

items.q: Which reptile group includes crocodiles and alligators?
items.a: Crocodilians - order Crocodylia

items.q: What pigment gives plants their green color?
items.a: Chlorophyll - absorbs blue and red light for photosynthesis

items.q: Which desert plant stores water in thick stems and has spines instead of leaves?
items.a: Cactus - adaptations reduce water loss

items.q: Which marine mammals are known for complex songs and baleen plates?
items.a: Humpback whales - filter feeders with elaborate vocalizations

items.q: Which biome features evergreen conifers and long winters across high latitudes?
items.a: Taiga (boreal forest) - dominated by spruce, fir, and pine

items.q: Which fungi‑plant association aids nutrient uptake in roots?
items.a: Mycorrhizae - mutualistic relationship enhancing absorption

items.q: What sequence begins 0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8…?
items.a: Fibonacci sequence - each term is the sum of the previous two

items.q: What is the value of the golden ratio φ to two decimal places?
items.a: Approximately 1.62 - (1+√5)/2 ≈ 1.618

items.q: What do we call a number divisible only by 1 and itself?
items.a: Prime number - fundamental in number theory

items.q: What is the sum of interior angles of a triangle?
items.a: 180 degrees - in Euclidean geometry

items.q: Which theorem relates the sides of a right triangle (a²+b²=c²)?
items.a: Pythagorean theorem - c is the hypotenuse

items.q: What do we call a polygon with all sides and angles equal?
items.a: Regular polygon - e.g., equilateral triangle, square

items.q: What is the decimal expansion that repeats the pattern 0.333… called?
items.a: Recurring (repeating) decimal - equals 1/3

items.q: What is 7! (7 factorial)?
items.a: 5040 - product of integers from 1 to 7

items.q: What do we call symmetry around a central point where rotation leaves a figure unchanged?
items.a: Rotational symmetry - order depends on number of orientations

items.q: What is the least common multiple (LCM) of 6 and 8?
items.a: 24 - smallest multiple divisible by both numbers

items.q: Who invented the first successful airplane in 1903?
items.a: The Wright brothers (Orville and Wilbur) - first powered, controlled flight at Kitty Hawk

items.q: Who developed the first practical lightbulb with a long‑lasting filament?
items.a: Thomas Edison - carbon filament lamp commercialized in 1879

items.q: Who invented the safety elevator with a fail‑safe brake?
items.a: Elisha Otis - demonstration in 1854 boosted skyscraper development

items.q: Who created the first commercially successful photographic process (daguerreotype)?
items.a: Louis Daguerre - introduced in 1839

items.q: Who pioneered the assembly line for mass production of automobiles?
items.a: Henry Ford - Model T production revolutionized manufacturing

items.q: Who is credited with inventing the modern refrigerator using vapor compression?
items.a: Carl von Linde - 1876 refrigeration cycle improvements

items.q: Who pioneered radio transmission and received the 1909 Nobel Prize?
items.a: Guglielmo Marconi - long‑distance wireless telegraphy

items.q: Who invented the first commercial microprocessor in 1971?
items.a: Intel team (Federico Faggin, Ted Hoff, Stan Mazor) - Intel 4004

items.q: Who patented the first practical typewriter and QWERTY keyboard layout?
items.a: Christopher Latham Sholes - U.S. patent in 1868

items.q: Who invented the first mechanical television system demonstrated in 1926?
items.a: John Logie Baird - early electromechanical TV pioneer
